resources.string: Please, answer at least one question to proceed
Who is the only U.S. President to invent and patent something?
For whom high heeled shoes were invented?
What beverage was invented by Charles Alderton in 1885 in Waco, Texas?
How many predictions of Jules Verne were realized?
What piece of clothing was invented by French fashion designer Louis Reard in 1946?
Who invented the first controllable flying Airplane?
The yo-yo was first used by hunters as weapons. They were wooden disks on strings. In the 1920s, a man from the U.S. named Donald Duncan made the yo-yo into a toy after he visited the Philippines.
In 1849 Honest Abe (Abraham Lincoln) invented a method to aid ships that got stuck on sandbars. It was never used.
King Louis XIV was very short and didn\'t like looking up at people he spoke to, so he had a tall pair of shoes made for him.
It\'s Dr. Pepper! The cherry-flavored cola made its debut at Morrison\'s Old Corner Drugstore.
\"Monopoly\" was brought out for Christmas 1934. The first games were hand drawn on linoleum with streets from Atlantic City, N.J. as the property.

To date, 64 of the 108 predictions that Jules Verne made in his science fiction works have been implemented. Among them, television and phototelegraph, an escalator and a moving pavement, a flight to the moon and organ transplantation, and much more.
The bikini, a two-piece swimsuit named for the Bikini Atoll in the Pacific, made its debut on July 5, 1946.
The first toothbrush was made out of a bone and small brush, by jail prisoner William Addis of England.

Wilbur and Orville Wright made the first successful controlled powered flight at Kitty Hawk, North Carolina, in December 1903. The twelve second flight covered a distance of 120 feet and an altitude of just ten feet.
